title: Drawing, "Two Walking Men and Breakwater at Suez Canal, Port Said, Egypt", 1868
markings: Stamped in ink, at lower left:  Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite, from left at various locations across top: red / blue / yel brown / black; at right: yel / brown/ white/ belt/ blue/ pantalons; and at center: dark / pink.

Verso: Inscribed in graphite, at upper left: white / red/ Dark / blue; at upper right: red / blue jacket / white; and across bottom: Breakwater at Suez Canal / Port Said.
description:
Recto:  Eleven designs of men or parts of them, a standing child shown from the right back (bottom row), two crouching dogs (center left, bottom right), a standing dog (bottom center), a fez (top right). 

Verso: Top row: a walking man shown from the left back; and at bottom: a heap of oblong stones.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Two Walking Men and Breakwater at Suez Canal, Port Said, Egypt", 1868.
1868. Graphite on cream-colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-38.
